p: The broth microdilution technique with some modifications was used to determine the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of the EO against bacteria and C. albicans strains [ 25– 27]. Chloramphenicol (1 to 64 μg/mL) and voriconazole (0.019 to 1.25 μg/mL) were used as reference antibiotics for bacteria and Candida, respectively.
